intro: Epistephium kubiyuense, commonly known as the Kubiyu epistephium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in wetlands or near water sources. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
